response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age (19 years old)", "high", "Youth is associated with higher recidivism risk."),
    ("Gender (Male)", "high", "Males statistically show higher rates of recidivism."),
    ("Race (Black)", "medium", "Race has been controversially associated with risk profiles; data may reflect structural factors."),
    ("Arrest History (10 arrests, convicted)", "high", "Extensive arrest and conviction history indicates strong recidivism trends."),
    ("Physical Attributes (6'11\", 165 lbs)", "low", "Unusual height and low weight are not established predictors for criminal recidivism."),
    ("Marital Status (Never married, living alone)", "medium", "Lack of stable family ties may contribute to higher risk."),
    ("Education (High school diploma, not enrolled in college)", "medium", "Limited post-secondary education opportunities may hinder rehabilitation."),
    ("Employment (No jobs held during the year)", "high", "Employment instability is strongly correlated with higher recidivism risk."),
    ("Substance Use (Marijuana use in past four years)", "medium", "Regular drug use, even marijuana, can be linked to increased risk though less severe than harder substances."),
    ("Mental Health (No depression in past month)", "low", "Absence of current depressive symptoms reduces immediate mental health risk factors."),
    ("Early Life Environment (Urban household with biological mother)", "medium", "An urban upbringing can be associated with exposure to higher crime rates, though family ties are present."),
    ("Religious Belief (Believes God influences his life)", "low", "Spiritual beliefs may act as a protective factor, promoting personal accountability.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 80
}

risk_factors: Youth is associated with higher recidivism risk.
Males statistically show higher rates of recidivism.
Race has been controversially associated with risk profiles; data may reflect structural factors.
Extensive arrest and conviction history indicates strong recidivism trends.
Unusual height and low weight are not established predictors for criminal recidivism.
Lack of stable family ties may contribute to higher risk.
Education (High school diploma, not enrolled in college)
Limited post-secondary education opportunities may hinder rehabilitation.
Employment (No jobs held during the year)
Employment instability is strongly correlated with higher recidivism risk.
Substance Use (Marijuana use in past four years)
Regular drug use, even marijuana, can be linked to increased risk though less severe than harder substances.
Mental Health (No depression in past month)
Absence of current depressive symptoms reduces immediate mental health risk factors.
Early Life Environment (Urban household with biological mother)
An urban upbringing can be associated with exposure to higher crime rates, though family ties are present.
Religious Belief (Believes God influences his life)
Spiritual beliefs may act as a protective factor, promoting personal accountability.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 10 times and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 11 inches and weighs 165 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
